description: [The Conversation Africa] Thirteen-year-old Salamatu Jalloh had her whole future to look forward to. But in January 2023, her lifeless body was found wrapped in a pink and blue shroud on an earthen floor in a village in north-west Sierra Leone.
title: Africa: Female Genital Mutilation Is On the Rise in Africa - Disturbing New Trends Are Driving Up the Numbers

description: [Reporter] Aid agencies warn close to two million Ethiopians at risk
title: East Africa: Flooding Poses Serious Threat in Nine Regional States As Climate Fluctuations Take Toll On East Africa

description: [ISS] With little sign that violent crime is under control, oversight by the minister is vital for effective policing.
title: Africa: How Can South Africa's Minister of Police Improve Policing?

description: [UN News] The first-ever UN civil society conference held in Africa wrapped up in Nairobi on Friday hearing calls for "bold and honest" conversations among governments and civil society to drive forward shared vision for reinvigorated multilateralism, a better world and a brighter future for all.
title: Africa: 'Keep Working With Us to Build a Better World,' Guterres Says, As Major UN Civil Society Forum Closes in Kenya

description: [The Conversation Africa] Wild chimpanzees have been studied for more than 60 years, but they continue to delight and surprise observers, as we found during the summer of 2017 in Kibale National Park in Uganda.
title: Africa: Playing With the Kids Is Important Work for Chimpanzee Mothers

description: [The Conversation Africa] Every year the world uses 4 billion tonnes of cement to make the concrete that goes into buildings and other infrastructure. It leaves a huge carbon footprint, and comes with other costs too.
title: Africa: Cement Is a Big Carbon Emitter and Quality Is Costly - a Civil Engineer Explains

description: [The Conversation Africa] A case of Lassa fever has been reported in Paris, France, sparking lurid warnings about the "horrific Ebola-like bug".
title: Africa: Lassa Fever Case in Paris - What You Need to Know

description: [ISS] The African Union lacks a coherent strategy that can reduce tensions between countries and improve security coordination.
title: Africa: Bold African Union Role Needed to Stabilise East DRC

description: [WHO] Governments of the world today agreed to continue working on a proposed pandemic agreement, and to further refine the draft, ahead of the Seventy-seventh World Health Assembly that starts 27 May 2024.
title: Africa: Governments Agree to Continue Their Steady Progress On Proposed Pandemic Agreement Ahead of the World Health Assembly
